passages.text: Signs emerging of weather demand over 2H25

- Grid investment growth in China declined in July on the back of a continued sharp slowdown in renewables buildout. Reported grid infrastructure investment contracted by \(-1\%\) yoy last month, although YTD it is still up \(12.5\%\) through July (Figure 7). Despite a noticeable yoy reduction in solar and wind installations in July, year-to-date levels of installations still remain elevated relative to last year's pace. Overall, additional Chinese solar installations in July were \(9.6\mathrm{GW}\) (-57% yoy), bringing the Jan-Jul total to 223 GW (+77% yoy) (Figure 8). Meanwhile, additional installations in wind were 2.3 GW (-40% yoy) last month, bringing the total for the first seven months to around 54 GW (+86% yoy) (Figure 10).

- Autos still resilient though likely to begin decelerating over 2H25. Chinese passenger vehicle production increased by \(13\%\) yoy and \(14\%\) YTD yoy through July, with NEV production a significant contributor, growing by \(37\%\) YTD yoy (Figure 18 & Figure 19).

- White goods are currently in a season lull. AC production in July increased by \(2\%\) yoy (Figure 13), while fridge & freezer and washing machine production were up by \(12.4\%\) and \(14.7\%\) yoy respectively (Figure 15 & Figure 17).

- Monthly property completion momentum sharply reversed. While there was a slight improvement in China's monthly completions across the property and construction sector in June, it reversed sharply to a decline of \(-30\%\) yoy in July (June: \(-2\%\) ) (Figure 5). This is in conjunction with further deterioration in fixed asset investment in construction which decreased by \(-25\%\) yoy last month (Table 4).

- After strong frontloading over 1H25, implied Chinese copper demand growth contracted yoy in July. The slowdown in solar installations and the further drft from property completions significantly impacted the consumption-weighted end use indicator for Chinese copper demand growth (-1.4% yoy in July vs. \(+4.2\%\) yoy in June) (Figure 22). The indicators are signaling Chinese demand over 2H25 is slowing markedly compared to the pace in 1H25.

- Chinese inventory levels still hovering well below the 5-year average, while COMEX and LME warehouses saw inflows. Global visible copper inventory reached nearly 600 kt in August, as COMEX and LME warehouses had inflows of 13 kt and 18 kt respectively over the month (Figure 28). Whereas inventory levels in China (SHFE + Bonded) continue trending sideways with no meaningful withdraws since early May (Figure 30).

- Smelter production in China still resilient amid concentrate tightness. China's copper concentrate imports increased by \(18\%\) yoy and refined copper production was up by \(14\%\) yoy in July (Figure 37& Figure 42). Although production remains strong, downstream purchases are reportedly weak, according to SMM, with onshore premiums in China declining from the levels
See page 28 for analyst certification and important disclosures.
at the start of the year (Figure 31).

- Weaker Chinese demand drives an upward trend in visible stocks while smelters keep adding capacity. Annualized Chinese refined aluminium production crept up by \(0.6\%\) yoy to \(43.8\mathrm{Mt}\) in July (Figure 70), driven by increased smelter capacity. Unwrought aluminium & product exports declined by \(-8\%\) yoy last month while imports of the same were higher by \(1.7\%\) YTD through July (Figure 59& Figure 60). Apparent consumption in China was down by \(-2\%\) yoy in July, as visible stocks continue trending up, indicating weak demand from downstream purchasers (Figure 57 & Figure 55).

- Still no signs of improving end-use demand in China. Refined zinc output in China increased by \(23\%\) yoy in July (Figure 84), given strong concentrate imports last month \(+34\%\) yoy (Figure 81). Chinese smelters have been increasing their output over the last few months despite weak end-use demand growth. Demand from galvanisers remains subdued, which continues to weigh on spot premiums (Figure 76). Visible inventory in China continues to build counter-seasonally with potential for a turnaround once the peak season kicks off in September/October (Figure 75 & Figure 83).

- Global cathode inventory now covers 31 days of demand. China's refined nickel imports jumped to \(38\mathrm{km}\) in July, the highest level since Dec 2017 (41 kmt) (Figure 90), while refined nickel exports increased by \(3\%\) yoy last month. Overall, prices were rangebound in July and still trade into the cost curve. SMM reports stainless steel demand is starting to recover slowly. Global visible inventory reached \(-320\mathrm{km}\) with flows into LME and SHFE warehouses \((+8\mathrm{km}\) and \(1.5\mathrm{km}\) , respectively) (Figure 86).
Figure 1: Consumption-weighted end use indicator for Chinese copper demand growth

Figure 22: Consumption-weighted end use indicator for Chinese copper demand growth

\*This indicator applies consumption- weights to underlying reported end- use production/installation/export growth figures to derive an estimate for monthly aggregate Chinese copper demand growth. It covers construction, grid, solar, wind, EVs, other transport, consumer durables, ACs/refrigeration, machinery and product and cable exports which, combined, roughly account for \(90\%\) of Chinese end use demand. Data through July 2025. Source: China National Energy Administration, China Automotive Tech and Research Center, Tianjin, NBS, China Customs, Bloomberg L.P., J.P. Morgan Commodities Research
